ygData.msgSnippet: ... This requires a little clarification, just so everyone doesn t get totally scared away from even trying Zek. :)  You can loot any *one* item a person has
ygData.messageBody:
Robert \"Nokker\" Venters wrote:

> From: "Robert \"Nokker\" Venters" <dread@...>
>
> > Since you apparently are a person who has been PK'd, I have some questions
> > about how PK works. Not that I would ever play that way, I hated UO for
> > that one reason. It's bad enough we got insta kill monsters, having to
> > worry about them, and other players attacking make it way to complicated for
>
> > me.
> >
> > Anyways, if you PK someone, how much can you loot? Everything?
> > Percentages, etc.
> > also in a duel, if you win, what are you allowed to loot off the other
> > player? Items? Money? Nothing?
> >
> the rules for a pk are the same as looting rules for a duel ,,
> you are able to loot anything that is equipped ,, or in an open inventory
> slot ,,, plus all the money on the corpse ,,,
>

This requires a little clarification, just so everyone doesn't get totally
scared
away from even trying Zek. :) You can loot any *one* item a person has on
them, not including containers or anything stored in containers, plus you can
loot all the money. However, *anyone* can loot you for a few seconds after
a player kills you - whenever I'm getting attacked by a mage much higher than
me with no chance of escape, I tell my friends to stand right by me and loot me
the second I die - That way, the killer gets nothing, I lose nothing.

Lohengrin
-level 22 bard on Fennin Ro (semi-retired)
-level 16 bard on Rallos Zek (and still wearing patch) :(
